column4: hey i can't really get rid of compiz fusion and emerald theme manager, i have tried to sudo apt-get autoremove them both but they kinda keep hanging around

hey i can't really get rid of compiz fusion and emerald theme manager, i have tried to sudo apt-get autoremove them both but they kinda keep hanging around does anybody know how to delete them for good?

hey i can't really get rid of compiz fusion and emerald theme manager, i have tried to sudo apt-get autoremove them both but they kinda keep hanging around does anybody know how to delete them for good?
u dont use autoremove, u use remove
sudo apt-get remove compiz emerald
Package compiz is not installed, so not removed
how did u install them
apt-get install
how are they "sticking around"
what exactly do u mean
they are still installed.. i still have the compiz settings manager, and emerald theme manager is still the one choosing my themes..
run "metacity --replace", then run "sudo apt-get remove ccsm"
probably u shud do metacity --replace in a run box, alt+f2
if u already did it do it AGAIN in a run box
did metacity --replace in a runbox: what was the next thing again?
did metacity --replace in a runbox: what was the next thing again?
sudo apt-get remove ccsm
thx in a terminal or runbox? term right
if that doesnt work, it might be "compizconfig-settings-manager", not "ccsm"
the long one is working, thx
do you know how i can get the minimized windows back on a toolbar? i accidentally deleted it
this will close all of ur running programs, but to "reset" ur interface so to speak, hit Ctrl+Alt+Backspace
nope that doesent work i think Natsuki is right on the money actually
no idea wut ur talkin bout.
